preqs: Students must have passed ETC1000, or be enrolled in course 4439.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed a unit in {ETC1010, STA1010} OR  Permission required)
Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ETC1000, ETC1010} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {4439} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETC1000} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true

description: This unit will introduce students to basic financial and stochastic techniques used in actuarial work, and will give an overview of some of the areas in which actuaries are currently involved. The student will be introduced to the basic concepts involved in assessing and pricing future risks and pricing insurance products, using past data.
